meanings.definition: To make or become less hard.
meanings.sent1: She softened the butter by leaving it out on the counter.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream softened in the sun and started to melt.
meanings.sent3: The tough cookie finally softened after being dunked in milk.
meanings.sent4: His harsh words softened her heart like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The music softly played in the background, creating a softened atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To make less severe or intense.
meanings.sent1: He softened his tone when speaking to the upset customer.
meanings.sent2: The apology letter softened the anger of the offended party.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher softened her rules for the class party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile softened the tension in the room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The kind words from her friend softened the blow of bad news.
